description: This file defines a mock class 'ServiceMock' for unit testing, which implements the 'WPEFramework::PluginHost::IShell' interface. It uses Google Mock to generate mock methods for various service functionalities, including path retrieval, system operations, and plugin management.

classes.name: ServiceMock
classes.description: A mock implementation of the 'WPEFramework::PluginHost::IShell' interface for testing.

methods.name: Versions
methods.description: Returns the version string of the service.

methods.name: Locator
methods.description: Returns the locator string for the service.

methods.name: ClassName
methods.description: Returns the class name of the service.

methods.name: Callsign
methods.description: Returns the callsign associated with the service.

methods.name: State
methods.description: Returns the current state of the service.

methods.name: Resumed
methods.description: Indicates whether the service has resumed.

methods.name: IsSupported
methods.description: Checks if a feature or operation is supported, based on a uint8_t parameter.

methods.name: EnableWebServer
methods.description: Enables the web server with given parameters.

methods.name: SubSystems
methods.description: Retrieves the subsystems associated with the service.

methods.name: Submit
methods.description: Submits a request identified by a uint32_t ID with an associated JSON element.

methods.name: Notify
methods.description: Sends notifications with specified string identifiers.

methods.name: QueryInterfaceByCallsign
methods.description: Queries an interface based on call sign and call ID.

methods.name: Background
methods.description: Indicates if the service is running in the background.

methods.name: ProxyStubPath
methods.description: Returns the path to the proxy stub.

methods.name: Activate
methods.description: Activates the service with a reason.

methods.name: Deactivate
methods.description: Deactivates the service with a reason.

methods.name: Unavailable
methods.description: Marks the service as unavailable with a reason.

methods.name: Reason
methods.description: Returns the reason for the current state or event.

methods.name: ConfigLine (overloaded)
methods.description: Configures line with a string parameter.
